text: Liudmila Sergeyevna Belavenets (also spelled Lyudmila Sergeevna Belavenets; ; 7 June 1940 – 7 November 2021) was a Russian chess player. She was the fourth women's world champion (1984–1992) 4\. Ladies World Championship Final crosstable. ICCF. and was won the titles of Lady Grandmaster and International Master in 1991.Belavenets, Lyudmila Sergeevna profile at ICCF She was born in Moscow. Belavenets died on November 7, 2021, from COVID-19 during the COVID-19 pandemic in Russia, aged 81.Ушла из жизни Людмила Белавенец ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Moscow Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Moscow Category:Russian chess players
title: Liudmila Belavenets
